title: Freire (Nuno Pereira)
body: He was the first governor and captain-general of Madeira appointed after the liberation of Portugal from the Castilian yoke. His appointment dates back to August 9, 1641, and he took office on March 20, 1642.

Nuno Pereira Freire: He was the first governor and captain-general of Madeira appointed after the liberation of Portugal from the Castilian yoke.

1641: Appointment as governor and captain-general of Madeira
